intro: Whitlavia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered whitlavia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, hairy stems and produces showy yellow-orange inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Whitlavia grandiflora is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
